data.title: Support Your Local Newsroom
data.meta_description: During this global pandemic, show local news some love at a time when we need trusted, factual, on-the-ground journalism. Use Command+F on a Mac, or Ctrl+F on a PC to find a specific state, region (South, Southwest, Midwest, Northeast and West) or newsroom. Click on the newsroom name to support that newsroom’s Report for America
data.text:
During this global pandemic, show local news some love at a time when we need trusted, factual, on-the-ground journalism.

Use Command+F on a Mac, or Ctrl+F on a PC to find a specific state, region (South, Southwest, Midwest, Northeast and West) or newsroom.

Click on the newsroom name to support that newsroom’s Report for America corps member.

For a full list of our 2020-2021 partner newsrooms, please click here.

SOUTH

Florida

El Nuevo Herald, Miami, FL: 1) Nicaraguan, Honduran, Dominican and other Latino communities 2) Presidential election through a Latino prism

Miami Herald, Miami, FL: Economic mobility in Dade County

Tampa Bay Times, St. Petersburg, FL: Seniors

WLRN Public Media, Miami, FL: 1) South Miami-Dade County 2) immigration

Georgia

Ledger-Enquirer, Columbus, GA: healthcare now and post-coronavirus

WABE, Atlanta, GA: Minority communities in south Atlanta

Kentucky

WFPL 89.3 News, Louisville, KY: Southern Indiana

Kentucky Center for Investigative Reporting, Louisville, KY: Youth, social services and legislative accountability

Lexington Herald Leader, Lexington, KY: 1) Health care in eastern and southern Kentucky 2) Watchdog reporting in eastern Kentucky 3) Photojournalist for rural communities

Northern Kentucky Tribune, Kentucky Forward, Kentucky Center, Edgewood, KY: Health care

Louisiana

The Times-Picayune and The Advocate, New Orleans, LA; Baton Rouge, LA; and Lafayette, LA: 1) Business coverage in New Orleans 2) St. Tammany Parish 3) K-12 Education in Lafayette 4) Higher ed in Baton Rouge 5) Livingston, Tangipahoa parishes 6) Public health in south Louisiana

WWNO 89.9 FM New Orleans Public Radio, Thibodaux, LA: 1) Bayou parishes, based in Thibodaux 2) Statehouse reporting in Baton Rouge

Maryland

Capital Gazette, Annapolis, MD: Military affairs, covering the U.S. Naval Academy and Fort Meade

Maryland Matters, Takoma Park, MD: 1) State elections, money & ethics 2) Health policy, including status of asbestos victims

Technical.ly, Baltimore, MD: Winners and losers in the tech economy in Baltimore

The Baltimore Sun, Baltimore, MD: 1) African-American neighborhoods 2) Latinos, the fastest growing minority group in the city

WYPR 88.1 FM, Baltimore, MD: Baltimore’s housing crisis

Mississippi

Mississippi Center for Investigative Reporting, Jackson, MS: Watchdog reporting

Sun Herald, Biloxi, MS: Vietnamese and African American neighborhoods

North Carolina

Carolina Public Press, Asheville, NC: Voting systems and election fraud in NC

La Noticia, Charlotte, NC: Affordable housing around Charlotte

North Carolina Health News, Chapel Hill, NC: Maternal health, prison health and other topics

The Charlotte Observer, Charlotte, NC: 1) The status of poor communities in a prosperous city 2) Affordable housing crisis in Charlotte

The News & Observer, Raleigh, NC: 1) Housing, gentrification and legislative accountability 2) Minority communities 3) Watchdog reporting about Hurricane Florence recovery

WFAE / Charlotte Mecklenburg Library / Digital Public Library of America, Charlotte, NC: 1) Unique partnership using both radio and Wikipedia to fill news deserts 2) Local government beat

WFAE 90.7 / La Noticia, Charlotte, NC: Immigration and deportation

WRAL-TV, Raleigh, NC: Eastern North Carolina

Puerto Rico

Centro De Periodismo Investigativo, San Juan, PR: 1) The education crisis 2) Watchdog reporting on recovery efforts following Hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico 3) Watchdog after Hurricane Maria

South Carolina

The Sun News, Myrtle Beach, SC: 1) Climate change & development in Georgetown County 2) Homelessness in Horry County

The Herald, Rock Hill, SC: Chester County, SC

The Island Packet, Hilton Head Island: 1) SC Development issues in Jasper County 2) Hilton Head’s working class

The State, Columbia, SC: Public housing and the Columbia Housing Authority

Tennessee

Chattanooga Times Free Press, Chattanooga, TN: Local coverage of religion

MLK50, Memphis, TN: Poverty, power and public policy in Memphis and Shelby County

WPLN / Nashville Public Radio, Nashville, TN: Criminal justice in Nashville

Virginia

Rappahannock News & Foothills Forum, Washington, VA: The changing nature of public services

West Virginia

100 Days in Appalachia, Morgantown, WV: White supremacy groups in Appalachia

Mountain State Spotlight, Charleston, WV: Investigative and enterprise reporting on 1) public health and 2) business and economic development and 3) data-driven projects

Charleston Gazette-Mail, Charleston, WV: 1) Business and economic reporting 2) Poverty in southern West Virginia

West Virginia Public Broadcasting, Charleston, WV: State government and southern WV

SOUTHWEST

Arizona

Arizona Public Media, Tucson, AZ: Watchdog reporting in Cochise County

KAWC Colorado River Public Media, Yuma, AZ: Latino communities

The Arizona Republic, Phoenix, AZ: African-American and Latino communities in South Phoenix

Nevada

KUNR Public Radio, Reno, NV: Education and Latino communities in Reno

New Mexico

Albuquerque Journal, Albuquerque, NM: Water resources in New Mexico

Las Cruces Sun-News, Las Cruces, NM: Public education, especially for poor residents in Las Cruces

New Mexico In Depth, Rio Rancho, NM: Urban Native Americans in Albuquerque

Santa Fe Reporter, Santa Fe, NM: Santa Fe’s Southside

Searchlight New Mexico, Santa Fe, NM: Healthcare, including mental healthcare, for the state’s poorest residents

Texas

Texas News Hub / KERA, El Paso, TX: Border and immigration issues

Dallas Morning News, Dallas, TX: 1) South Dallas 2) Second-generation immigrants

Fort Worth Star-Telegram, Fort Worth, TX: 1) Environmental issues caused by rapid economic development 2) City of Arlington

Houston Public Media, Houston, TX: Health issues in and around Houston

KUT, Austin, TX: 1) Costs and benefits of suburban growth in Williamson County 2) Hays County and development strains

San Antonio Express-News, San Antonio, TX: 1) Development in Texas Hill Country 2) Political dysfunction in suburban towns

Texas Public Radio, San Antonio, TX: 1) Texas Hill Country 2) Business issues in Laredo and other border areas

The Victoria Advocate, Victoria, TX: 1) Rural counties surrounding Victoria 2) Rural healthcare

Utah

KUER, Salt Lake City, UT: 1) Indigenous issues in southern Utah 2) Washington County 3) Accountability reporting on the energy industry

Salt Lake Tribune, Salt Lake City, UT: 1) Women’s issues 2) San Juan County

The Spectrum, St. George, UT: 1) National parks 2) Growth and related issues in Cedar City

MIDWEST

Illinois

Belleville News Democrat, Belleville, IL: 1) East St. Louis, IL 2) K-12 education

Block Club Chicago, Chicago, IL: 1) Austin and North Lawndale neighborhoods on the West Side of Chicago 2) Lakeview/Boystown/Lincoln Park areas, home to the largest population of the city’s LGBTQ community.

Chicago Sun Times, Chicago, IL: 1) South and West Chicago 2) Photojournalism of South and West sides of Chicago

Southern Illinois Local Media Group, Chester and Murphysboro, Du Quoin, IL: The town of Chester

The Chicago Reporter / Univision, Chicago, IL: Aurora, Elgin, Joliet, Cicero, Waukegan and other Chicago exurbs

The Daily Herald, Arlington Heights, IL: 1) Minority communities in Lake County 2) Northern DuPage County 3) State legislative races and local elections in suburban districts

WNIJ Northern Public Radio, DeKalb, IL: Substandard housing and police relations

Iowa

Iowa Public Radio, Des Moines, IA: Iowa statehouse, especially issues affecting underserved populations

Kansas

The Community Voice, Wichita, KS: African-American communities in Kansas City

Wichita Eagle, Wichita, KS: 1) Issues facing the working class, e.g. decline in unions, changes to state workers comp laws 2) Climate change in the midwest

Michigan

Detroit Free Press, Detroit, MI: 1) Formerly incarcerated citizens re-entering the community 2) economic mobility

Detroit Free Press/Politifact, Detroit, MI & St. Petersburg, FL: Fact-checking of Michigan politicians during election season and beyond

Detroit Public Television, Detroit, MI: 1) Early childhood education in metro Detroit 2) Threats to clean drinking water

FlintBeat.com, Flint, MI: 1) Public health, especially issues affecting Latinos 2) Photojournalism, especially efforts to restore Flint

Michigan Radio, Ann Arbor, MI: Mental health care in Michigan

Traverse City Record-Eagle, Traverse City, MI: Using data to tell stories of local and state issues and trends

Minnesota

Sahan Journal, St. Paul, MN: 1) Education of Hmong, Somali, Latino and other immigrant students 2) Immigration policy, especially affecting the Hmong, Somali and Latino communities 3) Photojournalist focusing on Hmong, Somali and Latino communities

Star Tribune, Minneapolis, MN: Issues of concern to younger voters

Twin Cities Public Television, St. Paul, MN: Causes, effects and solutions to racial disparities in Minnesota

Missouri

Kansas City PBS, Kansas City, MO: Rural issues in Missouri

The Beacon, Kansas City, MO: Environment and effect on health

St. Louis Public Radio, St. Louis, MO: Metro East area in Illinois

The Kansas City Star, Kansas City, MO: 1) A team approach to coverage of gun violence 2) Gun violence 3) Gun violence

Ohio

Akron Beacon Journal & Canton Repository, Akron, OH: Minority and immigrant issues

Mahoning Matters, Youngstown, OH: Watchdog reporting related to the decline in city services

The Columbus Dispatch, Columbus, OH: Rural issues in central Ohio

The Cincinnati Enquirer, Northern Kentucky: Government watchdog reporting in Northern Kentucky

The Devil Strip, Akron, OH: 1) Healthcare 2) Effect of economic forces on moderate and low income residents

The Plain Dealer, Cleveland, OH: Poverty in Cleveland, including housing, health and education

WKSU, Kent, OH: Rural healthcare

WYSO Public Radio, Yellow Springs, OH: Climate change and environmental issues

Wisconsin

Green Bay Press-Gazette, Green Bay, WI: Native American issues in Green Bay and Wisconsin

Milwaukee Journal Sentinel, Milwaukee, WI: 1) Latino neighborhoods on the city’s south side 2) Hmong, Native American and other under-covered ethnic communities

Milwaukee Neighborhood News Service, Milwaukee, WI: Low-income communities

Wausau Daily Herald, Wausau, WI: Population loss and its effects

Wisconsin Center for Investigative Journalism, Madison, WI: Criminal justice misconduct

NORTHEAST

Connecticut

Connecticut Public, Hartford, CT: 1) Naugatuck River Valley 2) Latino communities

The Connecticut Mirror, Hartford, CT: 1) Mental health and criminal justice 2) Photojournalism especially focused on communities of color

Washington, DC

DCist, Washington, DC: 1) Minority communities in Wards 7 and 8 in D.C. 2) Photojournalism involving minority communities in Wards 7 and 8

Delaware

Delaware Public Media, Dover, DE: State and local election coverage

Maine

Pine Tree Watch, Augusta, ME: 1) State legislature and education 2) Energy and environment

Massachusetts

Bay State Banner, Boston, MA: How state legislative and city hall actions affect Boston’s African-American communities

The Berkshire Eagle, Pittsfield, MA: Legislative coverage affecting rural western Massachusetts

WCAI, Woods Hole, MA: Climate change impact in Cape Cod and the state’s southern shore

New Hampshire

Concord Monitor, Concord, NH: Healthcare and related issues affecting seniors

New Hampshire Union Leader and Sunday News, Manchester, NH: Rural northern New Hampshire

Valley News, West Lebanon, NH: 1) Environment and climate in the Upper Valley 2) Photojournalism in Northern New Hampshire and Vermont

New York

City Limits, New York, NY: Climate change and its implications for New York City

Democrat and Chronicle, Rochester, NY: 1) Public education in the “last in nation” district 2) Puerto Rican community

The City, The Bronx, NY: Juvenile justice in the Bronx

The Haitian Times, Brooklyn, NY: 1) Brooklyn’s Haitian community 2) Miami’s Little Haiti, especially climate change gentrification and immigration

Pennsylvania

WITF, Harrisburg, PA: 1) Local Latino angle on elections 2) Latino communities in Reading, Lebanon and others

Rhode Island

The Public’s Radio, Providence, RI: Race and poverty in Newport, R.I.

Vermont

Vermont Public Radio, Colchester, VT: Northeast Kingdom

VTDigger.org, Montpelier, VT: Southern Vermont

WEST

Alaska

Anchorage Daily News / adn.com, Anchorage, AK: Healthcare and public health in Alaska

KCAW, Sitka, AK: Sitka and surrounding communities

California

Berkeleyside, Berkeley, CA: Immigrant businesses in Oakland

CALmatters, Sacramento, CA: Poverty (a partnership with San Jose Mercury News and the Fresno Bee)

EdSource, Oakland, CA: 1) K-12 education crisis among immigrants 2) Higher education among immigrants

inewsource, San Diego, CA: Growth and development in San Diego County’s backcountry

Long Beach Post, Long Beach, CA: West Long Beach

Mission Local, San Francisco, CA: Inequality and income disparities in Mission District

Radio Bilingüe, Fresno, CA: San Joaquin Valley

Redding Record Searchlight, Redding, CA: Education, childhood trauma and the achievement gap

Sacramento Bee, Sacramento, CA: 1) Asian-American issues in California 2) Latino communities

San Jose Mercury News, San Jose, CA: Childhood poverty in California

The Desert Sun, Palm Springs, CA: 1) Growing senior population in the Palm Springs area 2) Native American issues in Coachella Valley

The Fresno Bee, Fresno, CA: 1) Childhood poverty in California 2) Latino issues in Fresno and the region

The Mendocino Voice, Boonville, CA: The effect of environmental regulation on salmon runs, wildfires, the economy and other issues

The Modesto Bee, Modesto, CA: 1) Children’s health in the Central Valley 2) Economic development, and its impacts, in Stanislaus County and the Northern San Joaquin Valley

Ventura County Star, Camarillo, CA: Equity in education

Voice of OC, Santa Ana, CA: North Central Orange County

Colorado

Ouray County Plaindealer, Ridgway, CO: Coverage of North Central Ouray County

Hawaii

Honolulu Civil Beat, Honolulu, HI: 1) Military and veterans affairs 2) Public health disparities among Native Hawaiians

Idaho

Boise State Public Radio, Twin Falls, ID: Twin Falls and Blaine County

Post Register, Idaho Falls, ID: Rural healthcare

Montana

Yellowstone Public Radio, Billings, MT: 1) Montana Legislature 2) Native American issues

Oklahoma

Oklahoma Watch, Oklahoma City, OK: 1) Blight in northeast Oklahoma City 2) Oklahoma’s prison system

KOSU, Oklahoma City, OK: Agricultural and rural issues in the state

Oregon

Herald and News, Klamath Falls, OR: Endangered species, water rights and issues associated with a dam removal

Willamette Week, Portland, OR: East Portland, inequality and political representation

South Dakota

South Dakota Public Broadcasting, Vermillion, SD: Ethnic communities, including Native Americans

Washington

The Daily Herald, Everett, WA: Working-class issues, including housing and health care, in Snohomish County

The News Tribune, Tacoma, WA: Coverage of the Joint Base Lewis-McChord military installation

The Olympian, Olympia, WA: Homelessness, its causes and solutions

The Spokesman-Review, Spokane, WA 1) Statehouse 2) Public health in eastern Washington State 3) A Washington, D.C.-based reporter covering legislation affecting the Northwest

Wyoming

Buffalo Bulletin, Buffalo, WY: 1) Local energy industry in Johnson County 2) Photojournalism in Buffalo and surrounding areas

Wyoming Public Media, Wind River Reservation, WY: Wind River Reservation
